bioprojects.title: Hydrolagus colliei (spotted ratfish) genome, sHydCol1, haplotype 2

attributes.name: biomaterial_provider
attributes.value: University of Washington, Friday Harbor Labs; Karly Cohen and Gavin Naylor

biosample.biomaterialProvider: University of Washington, Friday Harbor Labs; Karly Cohen and Gavin Naylor

description.comment: The spotted ratfish (Hydrolagus colliei) is a chimaera found in the north-eastern Pacific Ocean, often seen by divers at night in the Pacific Northwest This cartilaginous fish gets its characteristic name from a pointed rat-like tail. (modified from Wikipedia entry). This sample is from a male individual collected from San Juan Island in the San Juan Channel of Washington State, by Karly Cohen of Friday Harbor Labs, and coordinated by Gavin Naylor to be used to generate a high-quality reference genome for the Vertebrate Genomes Project (VGP). Sequencing and genome assembly were conducted at the Vertebrate Genomes Lab (VGL) at the Rockefeller University, led by Olivier Fedrigo and Erich D. Jarvis.
description.title: Animal sample from Hydrolagus colliei (spotted ratfish) for VGP genome, sHydCol1
